title: Event handler for checkbox throws error in Node-Webkit
body:
I'm having trouble with a DOMExceptionError when clicking on a input element of type 'checkbox' when React is used in a Node-Webkit environment (Testing with Node-Webkit v0.86 win32, React v0.13.1.). Nothing tricky, browser context only, no use of require. Seems to only affect input elements when type is checkbox or file. The same code runs fine in the browser. Any thoughts on why it might be failing in Node-Webkit? [Test project - includes Node Webkit, win32 version](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B7LDtcYKl4iDdFhDVnVKcEhWbUE/view?usp=sharing) [Test project - without Node Webkit binaries](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B7LDtcYKl4iDd041WkZhZjRvSTA/view?usp=sharing) Console output after clicking on checkbox: ``` Download the React DevTools for a better development experience: http://fb.me/react-devtools react.js:113 Change Event SyntheticEvent {dispatchConfig: Object, dispatchMarker: ".0", nativeEvent: MouseEvent, type: "click", target: input…} _dispatchIDs: null _dispatchListeners: null bubbles: null cancelable: null currentTarget: null defaultPrevented: null dispatchConfig: null dispatchMarker: null eventPhase: null isDefaultPrevented: function () { isPropagationStopped: function () { isTrusted: null nativeEvent: null target: null timeStamp: null type: null __proto__: SyntheticEvent main.js:6 Error DOMException {message: "An attempt was made to use an object that is not, or is no longer, usable.", name: "InvalidStateError", code: 11, stack: "Error: An attempt was made to use an object that i…atch (file:///C:/nw/react-test/react.js:10691:18)", INDEX_SIZE_ERR: 1…} code: 11 message: "An attempt was made to use an object that is not, or is no longer, usable." name: "InvalidStateError" stack: "Error: An attempt ``` HTML: ``` html Mesheven
App
``` main.js: ``` js require('nw.gui').Window.get().showDevTools(); handleChange = function(evt) { try { console.log('Change Event', evt); } catch(e) { console.log('Error', e); } }; React.render ( React.createElement('input', {type: 'checkbox', onChange: handleChange}), document.getElementById('app') ); ```
